questions.question: What is the cardinality of the power set of a set with 5 elements?
Which of the following is NOT a property of a binary relation?
options: Reflexive
Symmetric
Transitive
Associative

questions.question: What is the chromatic number of a complete graph with 7 vertices?
A graph is called bipartite if...
options: It has two connected components
It has no cycles
Its vertices can be divided into two sets such that no edge connects vertices within the same set
It is planar

questions.question: What is the coefficient of x^3 in the expansion of (x+2)^5?
What is the principle of mathematical induction used to prove?
options: The existence of a solution to a problem
The uniqueness of a solution to a problem
The truth of a statement for all natural numbers
The correctness of an algorithm

questions.question: A function f: A -> B is called surjective (onto) if...
options: Every element in A is mapped to a unique element in B
Every element in B is mapped to by at least one element in A
f(x) = f(y) implies x = y for all x, y in A
f(x) = y for all x in A and y in B

questions.question: What is the difference between a permutation and a combination?
options: A permutation is an ordered arrangement, while a combination is an unordered selection
A combination is an ordered arrangement, while a permutation is an unordered selection
A permutation is a function, while a combination is a set
There is no difference between a permutation and a combination

questions.question: A recursive function is defined by...
options: A loop that executes a fixed number of times
A function that calls itself
A function that returns a value without any input
A function that takes multiple inputs and returns a single output

questions.question: What is the difference between a proposition and a predicate?
options: A proposition is a statement that is either true or false, while a predicate is a statement that can be true or false depending on the values of its variables
A predicate is a statement that is either true or false, while a proposition is a statement that can be true or false depending on the values of its variables
A proposition is a formula, while a predicate is a function
There is no difference between a proposition and a predicate
